{"step_by_step_thinking": "First, we need to understand what a prognostic factor is. A prognostic factor is any measurement that helps to predict the outcome of a disease. In this case, the question is asking if a patient's self-reported health-related quality of life can predict survival in non-small-cell lung cancer patients. There have been studies that show a correlation between a patient's self-reported health-related quality of life and their survival rate in non-small-cell lung cancer. Therefore, it can be considered a prognostic factor.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
